text: Tsushima Island (対馬, Tsushima) is a Japanese island in the waters between South Korea and Japan.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Tsushima" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 1002; US Department of State, "Limits in the Seas, No. 121; Straight Baseline and Territorial Sea Claims: South Korea," p. 23. Retrieved 4 September 2012. ==History== Beginning in the early 6th century, the island was a province of Japan, It was called Tsushima Province. In the Meiji period, the island and the province became part of Nagasaki Prefecture.Nussbaum, "Provinces and Prefectures" at p. 780. == Related pages == * Russo-Japanese War * Korea Strait * Tsushima Strait == References == == Other websites == * Tsushima City website * Tsushima profile * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Islands of Japan
title: Tsushima Island
